page.title: 15The Sandringham Club
page.content:
The Club stands opposite the church in the village of West Newton, and was provided by King Edward VII for the workers of the village. It served to provide the people with a place of recreation.
Today, the Club provides a similar but more extensive service. There is a comfortable bar where one can sit and talk while the more active can play darts, snooker, or bowls on the recently extended full-sized E.B.A. green.
The Club is run by its members and the committee employ a full-time steward.
There are no public houses on The Sandringham Estate.
